Message.Title: Biggest Opportunity for Next Week
Message.Msg: Concurrent (CCUR) could explode next week very low float completely undiscovered yet the company is the world's #1 video on demand (VOD) technology provider to the cable TV industry with clients including 6 of America's top 8 largest cable TV companies. At current price of $7.84 CCUR's enterprise value is only $47.5mm or just 0.76x its revenue. Huge gross margins of 58% compared to CCUR's top rival Seachange (SEAC)'s gross margins of 50% yet SEAC is now trading with enterprise value/revenue ratio of 1.89, which will value CCUR over $15.50 per share! Look for CCUR to break $8 and explode next week - CCUR will likely be hottest play in the entire market! A $23 billion company Virgin Media (VMED) is now deploying CCUR's technology and almost nobody knows yet! CCUR's EPS has been rapidly growing each quarter faster than every other public technology company in existence! Last quarter CCUR's EPS was up 100% from quarter before and 300% from two quarters ago! CCUR's chart looks amazing, double digits should arrive very quickly after CCUR breaks $8!

Topic.Title: We are on our way out and Obama is leading the way

Message.Msg: Our problems typically don't start with President's serving eight years; it begins and unfortunately too often doesn't end with 'professional' members of Congress. That is where most of the less than honest relationships with lobbyists are created, nurtured and reinforced. Members of Congress that are more and more often starting to thinks of themselves as some sort of powerful royalty rather and servants and representatives of the people are where most of our problems begin. They consistently create problems that then have to be solved in 'crisis' mode and while they, who created the problems, insist that we believe they are the only people on the planet with the intelligence and experience to solve these self-inflicted problems. The understand that if they keep sharing our treasury in huge displays of generosity toward the weak, helpless and in overabundance with the lazy, stupid and corrupt they will continue to vote for them. They perpetuate the philosophy that no one in their right mind would ever vote against someone willing to give them something for nothing.

Topic.Title: We are on our way out and Obama is leading the way

Message.Msg: Many consider a full-on democracy to be where the majority rules. If the majority votes for an action, idea or law then it should be the law of the land; strange then that the people of California and several other states have voted, in large majorities to ban gay marriage but now it is being forced into court. What happened to majority rule in a democracy? Conveniently many liberals are convinced and will quote that ‘we won; we should get our way because the majority voted us in’. However when the majority votes for something they don’t like, they want the right to force their opinions on others regardless of the majority. I find that the concept of majority rule to be null and void if any minority complains. There was an example in the media this week where an Easter egg hunt was canceled because one family in the school complained. One family! There is no Constitutional right, or any other right to never be offended by something around you or a decision that you can avoid. We in America seem to have forgotten and forsaken many of these thoughts.

Topic.Title: they get guns from obama ricky

Message.Msg: They are also the areas with some of the toughest state and local gun laws and sentences. Which means more cases are prosecuted in state courts instead of Federal courts. Federal guns laws are very specific as well. For instance, since gun sales are prohibited in Chicago you simply won't see prosecutions for attempts to buy a gun by a felon. Syracuse-TRAC, which authored the report La Pierre referred to, noted that state and local prosecutions "dwarf" Federal prosecutions. Nice try, though. You can find the report by searching for "TRAC Reports: Federal Weapons Enforcement: A Moving Target"
